label.timeToTakeCareIsNow: The time to take care is now!
label.wantSavePicture: Do you want to save it?

step.title: Spread the soap
step.subTitle: Pass the soap over the entire surface of the hand

step.title: Soap
step.subTitle: Soak your palms by rubbing them together

step.title: Rub
step.subTitle: Rub the palm of your right hand against the back of your left hand, interlacing your fingers

step.title: Rub another hand
step.subTitle: Repeat the previous process with the left hand against the back of the right hand

step.title: Between fingers
step.subTitle: Interlace your fingers and rub the spaces between them

step.title: Fingertips
step.subTitle: Rub the back of the fingers of one hand with the palm of the opposite hand (and vice versa), holding the fingers, with a back-and-forth motion

step.title: Thumbs
step.subTitle: Rub your thumbs with the help of the palm of the opposite hand, using a circular motion

step.title: Shell
step.subTitle: Rub the digital pulps and nails of one hand against the opposite palm, cupped and making a circular motion

step.title: Rinse
step.subTitle: Now rinse your hands, avoiding direct contact of the soapy hand with the tap (try to use your elbows when opening)

step.title: Drying
step.subTitle: Dry them with a disposable or single-use paper towel when you're at home

step.title: Turning off the tap
step.subTitle: Use the paper towel to turn off the tap. Ready! Now your hands are safe

step.title: Toothpaste
step.subTitle: Squeeze a pea-sized blob of toothpaste onto a soft bristled brush

step.title: Movement
step.subTitle: Brush gently using circular motions. If you brush to hard it can harm your gums

step.title: All the way
step.subTitle: Brush all the surfaces of your teeth paying spacial attention to where the tooth meets the gum. This is where place builds up

step.title: Behind
step.subTitle: Remember to brush behind your front teeth using the tip of the toothbrush

step.title: Time
step.subTitle: Keep brushing for at least two minutes and do this morning and night
